description: Single storey detached outbuilding for use as an ancillary granny annexe
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) SBI.dwg Sheet 1 of 2 (Rev. A), SBI.dwg Sheet 2 of 2 (Issue A), Site Location Plan

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building (44 Waverley Gardens, North Circular Road, Park Royal, NW10, 7EE).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | The outbuilding hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes ancillary to the main dwellinghouse at 44 Waverley Gardens, North Circular Road, Park Royal, NW10, 7EE only and not for any other separate residential or commercial use.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with Policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | No kitchen shall be installed into the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with Policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).
